page.title: 01KINGSTON & HAMPTON WICK
page.content: The name of our town is the{Royal {Borough of Kingston upon Thames.} It got its name because seven Saxon kings were crowned here. Kingston grew up because the bridge was the only place where you could cross the{River {Thames}above London Bridge. Hampton {Wick}is just the other side of the river but it is not part of Kingston proper. It is mainly residential with a few shops, most of Hampton Wick is taken up by Bushy Park. This used to be a Royal hunting park. You could describe{Kingston}as a large town with all its shops and roads.The biggest shop is{Bentalls}store. The market place is very busy. There are a lot of stalls and lots of busy people buying things. Kingston is famous for the Coronation stone.It stands outside the Guildhall, a semi-circular building, where the council meet.
